text: Got itâ€”thanks for letting me know, wangenius.

Iâ€™m the projectâ€™s built-in intelligence analyst.
Think of me as a live briefing officer who can read every file, log, and config in the repo and turn it into plain-language answers.
Typical things I do:

1. Quick reconnaissance
   â€œWhich modules talk to the payment API?â€
   â€œShow me every place the word â€˜deprecatedâ€™ appears in the last 30 days.â€

2. Change-impact briefings
   â€œIf we bump Node to 20.x, which Dockerfile and CI jobs actually shift?â€

3. Risk & compliance scan
   â€œList every hard-coded credential or secret in the codebase.â€

4. Progress snapshots
   â€œHow many open TODOs are older than two weeks, and who owns them?â€

5. Task orchestration (quietly)
   If the answer needs more than ~30 s of work, I spin up a background Run, track it, and ping you when itâ€™s readyâ€”no commands to remember.

Just ask in everyday language; Iâ€™ll handle the grepping, cross-referencing and summarizing.
